Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD erred in concluding no persecution and adequate state protection in Hungary
Evidence_Type: Evidence of discrimination, state protection efforts for Roma in Hungary
Legal_Provision: IRPA - definition of refugee, persecution, state protection
Basis_of_Claim: Roma ethnicity, fear of persecution in Hungary
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to exhaust reasonable steps to seek state protection in Hungary
Regulation_Cited: IRPA sections related to refugee status and persecution
Application_Error: Applicants did not clearly rebut presumption of adequate state protection
Legal_Standard: Persecution under IRPA, adequacy of state protection
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB), Federal Court
Decision_Review_Issue: Interpretation of 'persecution' and adequacy of state protection
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of evidence showing inability or unwillingness of Hungary to protect
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections on refugee eligibility and persecution
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence to rebut state protection in Hungary
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to RPD's interpretation of persecution and state protection
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review process, standard of review
Omission_Type: Failure to pursue available domestic remedies in Hungary
